channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bags of dog fouling sporadically along Lyndon Ave, Sidcup, 27th February
item.description:
Bags of dog fouling sporadically along Lyndon Ave, Sidcup - caller is also requesting for dog stencils to be put down....there is also lots of dog fouling along the road from o/s 97 to the higher numbers
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 99, Lyndon Avenue, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes in Maple Crescent, 27th February
item.description:
You will see when you inspect the road surface in Maple Crescent that over the years temporary repairs have been made to the road surface In fact it lookslike a patchwork quilt. The potholes are getting worse (see accompanying photos) This is being made worse due to vehicles not wanting to wait in traffic at the ATS Wellington Ave j/w Blackfen Road and turning into Maple Crescent increasing traffic flow in the road. The whole road including the Cul de Sac in Maple Crescent needs totally resurfacing as the last time this was done was 30 years ago when a Thames Water main burst causing surgery flooding. The road markings have also faded or are no existent.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Maple Crescent, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin still not collected, 27th February
item.description:
Overflowing household blue waste bin not collected by either recycling or non recycling teams. Has been here >3 months and nothing done. Multiple bins that are broken without lids. Continually littering street. Please could refuse team collect contents of the blue bin and remove broken bins.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Dagmar Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Next to Bus Stop C outside Monro House, 27th February
item.description:
A massive pothole right at the bus stop. Many people have already had accidents due to them as they are unavoidable. Please attend urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fitzjohn's Avenue, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recycling bins x3 near Edmonton Green bus station are full, 27th February
item.description:
Recycling bins x3 near Edmonton Green bus station are full. Originally reported to 'FixMyStreet in April 2025 as the bins hadn't been emptied since about Autumn 2024 and rats were seen scuttling around the recycling bins. E-mailed the Ward Councillors for Lower Edmonton, Jubilee Ward and the MP for Edmonton on the 10th February 2026 regarding this - no reply as of the 27th February 2026 When were the bins last emptied?.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Church Street, Edmonton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping around the back of Royal Hill Court, 27th February
item.description:
Dear Environmental Services Team, I am writing to report a large-scale fly-tipping incident in the service alley behind Royal Hill Court. The dumped waste is approximately a van-load (around one third of a skip) and appears to be construction/commercial debris of unknown origin. This alley is a mixed-use access route used by: - Residents of Royal Hill Court - Multiple commercial back entrances - Council bin collection services Although the land appears to be owned by TfL (adjacent to a fenced TfL area), the location functions as a shared service alley affecting residential access and sanitation. This is not a minor dumping incident. The volume is significant, unsanitary, and has previously required private removal costing residents approximately £700, which is not sustainable and should not fall on residents where fly-tipping is involved. I also have asthma and am concerned about dust exposure from unknown construction materials being left in a confined residential access area. There may be toxic fibres in the debris I am unsure. Given: - The scale of the waste (van-load size) - The shared residential and waste collection use of the alley - The unsanitary conditions - The repeat nature of fly-tipping in this exact location I am requesting: 1) Inspection and clearance of the fly-tipped waste as a priority sanitation issue 2) Investigation into potential commercial dumping, particularly in relation to nearby skip activity 3) Confirmation of responsibility coordination between the council and TfL as landowner I can provide photographs and additional context if required, and nearby commercial CCTV (Sainsbury’s) may also be available showing vehicle activity. This situation is causing ongoing environmental distress and avoidance of the rear access area by residents, and I would greatly appreciate prompt action. Kind regards, James Beckwith Royal Hill Court Resident

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwich High Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
